alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 2:52AM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches expected. Winds may gust as high as 35 MPH. Dangerous wind chills as low as 25 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Lower elevations of Carbon County including Baggs, Rawlins, Saratoga, Muddy Gap, Shirley Basin, and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...5 AM MST Monday until 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions possible due to icy, snow packed roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Cold temperatures could lead to frostbite and hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Southwest Carbon County; Upper North Platte River Basin
